entry.et: Middle English, from Anglo-French, from Latin violentus; akin to Latin vis strength vim

def.dt: :marked by extreme force or sudden intense activity a violent attack
:notably furious or vehement a violent denunciation
:caused by force :not natural a violent death
:emotionally agitated to the point of loss of self-control became violent after an insult
:prone to commit acts of violence violent prison inmates
